column5: We need leadership in Washington that will protect our air, our water, and our health. Continuing down this path is unimaginable. More details here in this @nytimes feature: https://t.co/bVA9GKyZGy

A coal plant outside Houston, TX is spewing sulphur dioxide into the air without restrictions, spreading a toxic haze across state lines. Pollutants from coal mines in West Virginia are killing aquatic life in the area’s waterways.

Millions of pounds of a pesticide Obama tried to ban have been applied to crops in southern California, sickening farm workers. A daycare in the migrant center is located near these pesticide spraying areas, leaving infants and toddlers at risk of exposure.
In just two years, the Trump Administration has rolled back 78 environmental regulations, directly putting the health and safety of Americans at risk.
Today an estimated 800,000 federal employees will miss their first  paychecks of the year. Families are suffering. Our country is less safe. The impact of this shutdown is real.

It’s appalling how our health and safety are being put in jeopardy as a result of this government shutdown. This shows the administration puts political priorities over the American people. https://t.co/4ypQw6uxuw

One of the main problems at the border is that not enough judicial resources have been dedicated to dealing with the large numbers of people, many women and children, seeking asylum. A wall will not fix this problem. https://t.co/kANAB2Tzbn

column5: Wishing you a Merry Christmas and happy holidays! With aloha from our family to yours. https://t.co/LTN5OQdGAq

This completely preventable #shutdown has left 800,000 Federal workers furloughed or forced to work with no pay. Yet leaders in Washington who failed the American people still get paid. This is BS. I stand with our workers & won’t accept pay as long as the govt is shut down.
#FirstStepAct just signed into law — the first step toward long overdue criminal justice reform. This is what’s possible when you put people before politics.
2.…was the retreat of the Iraqi Army from Mosul in 2014, allowing ISIS to take over the city, capture US Humvees, equipment, & heavy weapons and use them against civilians in Iraq and Syria.

1. Lindsey Graham and other neocons/neolibs who say our troops must remain in Syria are wrong. We need to get out of Syria ASAP in a responsible manner (it shouldn’t take long). An example of an IRRESPONSIBLE withdrawal…

The hysterical reaction to the decision to withdraw troops from Syria is astonishing & shows just how attached to war some are. Lindsey Graham & others want us to continue our regime change war in Syria and to go to war with Iran. That’s why they’re so upset.

The underlying problem is that for too long our leaders have had no clear direction or objective when it comes to foreign policy.  So without a clear mission and objective, it’s impossible to know whether any particular decision will help us achieve that mission.

We need to get our troops out of Syria ASAP, but it must be done responsibly. Turkey will see this as an invitation to invade northern Syria, decimate our Kurdish allies, & strengthen jihadists like AQ/ISIS/etc, undermining our national security and causing more suffering.
On the House floor, just voted to pass #FirstStepAct - overwhelming bipartisan support. There is more to be done, but this is a big deal, thanks to the many hands who made this possible! @cut_50

“Dolphins! So graceful and mesmerizing.”
Question: What is your favorite marine animal?
“My husband proposed to me over his surfboard while we were out in the water at one of our favorite surf spots. The sun was setting, no one else was out, and love was in the air!”
Question: What is your favorite memory of the ocean?
“Here are some easy things we can all do: Recycle, walk, ride your bike, carpool, stop using single-use plastics, and avoid toxic sunscreens that kill our coral reefs."
Question: What can people do right now to help?

"Protecting our water is not a partisan political issue. It is vitally important to all people and living beings everywhere. Water is life—we can’t survive without it. Congress needs to work together to pass legislation to protect our oceans."
Question: What is the role of Congress in protecting our oceans?

“It’s not too late, but we can’t wait for the tide to change. Actions we take every day affect the air we breathe, food we eat, water we drink, and the land and oceans all around us. The people at today's #MarchForTheOcean understand this and are speaking up.”
Question: Do you think it is too late to save our oceans?

"The greatest threat to our oceans is if we fail to act on climate change. Ocean temperatures are rising, pollution riddles our waters, coral reefs are dying off and marine life are being killed. I introduced the OFF Act to stop fossil fuels from polluting our oceans."
Question: What do you think is the greatest threat to our oceans?

"I attended #MarchForTheOcean today because water is life. Growing up in Hawaiʻi we have a unique appreciation for why we must protect our resources—from our mountains all the way to our oceans. We have a responsibility to take care of our home."
Question: Why did you march today?

We must be willing to meet with adversaries or leaders of nations who aren't our allies to further the cause of peace. I strongly urge @realDonaldTrump to engage in direct talks with #NorthKorea's Kim Jong Un without preconditions. The stakes are high & there is no time to waste.

The seriousness of North Korea's nuclear threat to the American people cannot be overstated. The need for direct talks between Trump and Kim is critical and urgent to peacefully negotiate denuclearization of #NorthKorea, remove nuclear threat, and avoid all-out catastrophic war.

I strongly urge Congress to consider the serious consequences of Section 1225 which would authorize any or all of these actions. Congress must not cede its authority to declare war to the Administration. I urge my colleagues to vote YES on my amendment to strip Sec1225 from #NDAA

Without a clear objective, you end up in endless war. So what is the objective of #NDAA Section 1225 authorizing war to ‘counter Iran’? Is it regime change in Iran? Regime change in Syria? More war in Syria? Yemen?

For too long, the U.S. has engaged in military adventurism and interventionist wars, sending our troops overseas, with no clear objective or end state. ‘Countering Iran’ is not an end state that our military or diplomats can achieve.

Rather than dumping trillions more dollars into more interventionist regime change wars, we should be using our precious resources to invest in our communities here at home - providing clean water, rebuilding infrastructure, improving education, housing, healthcare & more

Im urging my colleagues to vote YES on the Gabbard amendment that will be up for a vote today in the House which will simply strip Section 1225 from the #NDAA - upholding our constitutional responsibility and preventing this blank check for endless war from becoming law.

Authorizing Section 1225 gives the Trump Administration total authority to keep deploying our troops to the Middle East as long as they want to, without any clear objective and without congressional authorization. This puts us on a dangerous path to endless war.

#Ndaa Section 1225 gives after-the-fact license to continuing U.S. military actions in Yemen supporting Saudi Arabia which have resulted in mass starvation, tens of thousands of dead civilians, and blockades causing one of the worst humanitarian disasters in history.

My amendment upholds Congress’s constitutional responsibility to declare war, and stops this #NDAA provision that sidelines the American people and cedes congressional authority to warhawks like John Bolton, Mike Pompeo, and Nikki Haley

In just a couple hours there will be a vote on the House floor on my amendment to strip the #NDAA of a provision that authorizes our military to go to war with Iran, without limits, and without any constitutionally required declaration of war by Congress or debate.

According to the National Institute of Justice, three out of every four people who spend time in prison will be rearrested for a new crime within five years. The #FIRSTSTEPAct is our opportunity to make real, bipartisan progress on reforming the criminal justice system right now. https://t.co/u0NtdpRHNB

Real change requires people coming together and taking action. #FIRSTSTEPAct will come before Congress tomorrow, with bipartisan support. But some are putting politics before the well-being of people, and opposing this. Urge Congress to vote YES for #prisonreform tomorrow.

Prisons are overcrowded, and they’re costing Americans big time -- America pays more than $80 billion a year to be exact. #FIRSTSTEPAct ensures pre-release halfway houses or home confinement is available and gives people tools to reenter society & end cycle of recidivism.
The #FIRSTSTEPAct makes sure that prisoners are treated, assessed, and rehabilitated with policies that are based on evidence, not personal or institutional bias.

The #FIRSTSTEPAct uses evidence-based approaches that have already been proven to help states like Texas, Alabama and Alaska reduce crime, keep families together, and shrink prison populations, reducing cost to taxpayers.

Formerly incarcerated people face huge legal obstacles to finding employment and housing after release. Rejoining society is often too difficult, leading to many ending up back behind bars. This leaves broken families in its wake. We need #prisonreform now.

One piece of legislation won’t fix every problem in our #criminaljustice system. The #FIRSTSTEPAct is the common ground that exists today where we can get something good done now that will have a direct effect on people’s lives, while we continue to work toward #prisonreform.

Too many people get stuck in our broken criminal justice system and never make it out. We can’t take an all or nothing approach to reform while so many people and families suffer under the status quo. The #FIRSTSTEPAct is the first step towards comprehensive #prisonreform.
According to the National Institute of Justice, three out of every four people who spend time in prison will be rearrested within five years. The #FIRSTSTEPAct can begin to change this. #prisonreform

In hyper-partisan Washington, passing bipartisan legislation is rare. But one thing that has brought Ds and Rs together is the need to fix our criminal justice system. Tomorrow we can begin to do that by passing the #FIRSTSTEPAct in the House. #prisonreform
We still need sentencing reform, but we can’t take an all-or-nothing approach on #prisonreform. We need to focus on the changes we can make today, and the #FIRSTSTEPAct is one of those changes.
The #FIRSTSTEPAct is an opportunity to make meaningful, positive policy changes on #prisonreform that work for the people of Hawaiʻi and the country at-large.

We can no longer afford to maintain the conditions of a broken system. We spend more than $80 billion a year locking up 2.3 million people—more than any country on earth. I support the #FIRSTSTEPAct and ask you to stand with me for real positive change.

Over 70 organizations like @cut_50 support the #FIRSTSTEPAct as they work to reduce our nation's prison population of 2.3M people. This bipartisan bill is an important first step to achieving comprehensive criminal justice & sentencing reform #prisonreform https://t.co/5PE2wEGXxK

The people of Hawai‘i know why it's so important that President Trump's meeting with Kim Jong Un move forward without delay—using every diplomatic tool at our disposal—in order to denuclearize North Korea, finally end the Korean War, and bring us closer to peace.

They believe direct talks should not occur or that there should be preconditions before agreeing to just have the conversation. The people of Hawai‘i know firsthand what it's like to live under the threat of an attack from North Korea at any time.

Nothing is more important to the people of America than peace. Unfortunately, there are some who don't understand the urgency of the situation or the seriousness of the nuclear threats that exist for the people of Hawai‘i and this country.

4) Urging the president, our international partners, and United Nations members to keep up the economic and diplomatic pressure until North Korea is rid of its nuclear, chemical, biological, and radiological weapons programs.

1) Welcoming the United States-North Korea summit that will follow the historic North-South summit that just occurred.

column5: Local businesses have stepped up and working hard to help support the relief efforts. And the heroes in the community who are all working hard to help their neighbors are just incredible - so much unity and aloha in this time of dire need. So honored to serve this community.

Just finished the shift change brief at Kauai Emergency Operation Center. More heavy rain last night. So impressed by the professionalism of the emergency response teams from Kauai county, the state and FEMA reps here. Other counties have sent in reinforcements to help.

I’m on the plane headed to Kauaʻi to help support our community there that has been hit with torrential downpours and catastrophic flooding this week. Many people evacuated,  power outages, homes and livelihoods swept away. More rain storms expected for the next couple days

People on Kauai are dealing with severe rainstorms and flooding that has caused power outages and forced evacuations. Here are some ways you can help—please spread the word. #aloha #kauaiflood https://t.co/W7BkY3eVTr

Fracking poisons our drinking water and degrades the environment wherever it occurs. We must move to 100% clean, renewable energy as fast as possible to protect people and our planet. That's why I introduced the #OFFAct to get us there by 2035.

It is unacceptable that the people of Flint continue to suffer from lead-contaminated water. Now they will no longer receive bottled water, the decision of a state gov't which was responsible for creating this crisis nearly 4 years ago. It has been 1,454 days. #FlintWaterCrisis
Please support Dennis Kucinich for Ohio governor. He's dedicated his life to fighting for peace, justice & equality  https://t.co/ute3NXUHZr
We must end our policy of interventionist regime change wars. The people of Syria want peace and stability so that refugees can return home and begin to rebuild their lives.

Thinking of all our friends on Kauai - please stay safe as the rains and flooding continues. I've heard from many who evacuated, now at @HawaiiRedCross shelters. Thanks to first responders who are helping keep people safe, and to the community coming together to help each other. https://t.co/xL7ihIDUzL
Sending my aloha and mahalos to Kauaʻi Democrats coming together for the county convention today! Mahalo to our #TeamTulsi volunteers! https://t.co/pYHOePG3uG

... so refugees can return home & begin to rebuild their lives, then we should work for peace, end our policy of interventionist regime change wars and stop trying to be the policeman of the world. (2/2)

The people of Syria desperately want to live in peace & do not want their country to be taken over by genocidal terrorist groups like al-Qaeda and ISIS. If we are truly concerned about the suffering of the Syrian people & bringing about peace & stability ... (1/2)
We owe it to our service members to send them on missions worthy of their great sacrifice, missions that are in the interests of the American people. #PeaceForSyria https://t.co/VZVJLzkZlJ

Our troops put their lives on the line for our country. Their sacrifice must be honored by sending them on missions worthy of their sacrifice; not interventionist regime change wars that cost our country lives & resources, & increase the suffering of those in countries we attack

U.S. military action in Syria could escalate into a war with Russia and Iran. Russia has already stated they will respond to any U.S. military attack against Syria. Is this our mission? How does going to war with Russia over Syria serve the interests of the American people?

The weaker the Syrian government and military are, the more dependent they will be on assistance from Russia and Iran, strengthening their positions and power in Syria. Is that our mission? Does that serve the interests of the American people?

Actions that weaken/cripple the Syrian military result in greater instability, more suffering of Syrian ppl, &  strengthen terrorist groups like al-Qaeda, ISIS, Army of Islam, etc. who are trying to topple the gvmnt. Is that our mission? Does this help Syrian or American ppl?

Our actions in Syria must be based on strategy, which is based on what our mission actually is. What are we trying to achieve? The neocons/neolibs calling on Trump to attack Syria either don't know what the mission is or are pursuing a mission that is contrary to U.S. interests.

As a soldier, I know that the most basic requirement before taking military action is that you must have a clear, achievable objective, & a strategy to achieve it. You must analyze the situation, know what the risks are, & what the cost, consequences of your actions will be

BREAKING: Tulsi Gabbard demands answers from Defense Secretary James Mattis on attacking Syria

@realDonaldTrump Resist the loud and bloody calls for more war from the neocons and warhawks, and instead wield the power of the Presidency to help bring peace to the people of Syria, their devastated country, and the region. #peaceforsyria

Bottom line: If our desire is for peace and stability in Syria so that refugees can return home & they can begin to rebuild their homes and lives, then we should work for peace rather than expanding and escalating the war thru a U.S. military attack against Syria. #peaceforsyria

@realDonaldTrump If you are truly concerned about the suffering of the Syrian people, you must do all you can to bring about peace. Attacking Syria will escalate the war, increase the suffering of the Syrian people, cause more death, & less resources for Americans here at home.

By launching a U.S. military attack against Syria, terrorist groups like al-Qaeda, ISIS, Jaysh al-Islam, etc, will be reinvigorated & resurrected in their quest to topple the government & establish a caliphate. This creates a greater threat to America & hell for the Syrian people

The people of Syria want peace more than anything in the world. Dropping bombs on Syria will not bring their war-torn country any closer to peace. It will escalate and prolong the war, resulting in more senseless death, destruction, suffering, and refugees.

Our unfortunate and brutal history of waging regime change wars has failed. Interventions in Iraq and Libya caused death, destruction, and human suffering. We have neglected our own communities. Military action should be the last resort, not our first.

The U.S. has been supporting Saudi Arabia illegally in this war for years, without authorization from Congress, required by the War Powers Act. Saudi Arabia wouldn't have been able to continue this years-long war & their horrific war crimes without US logistics support & US bombs

Once again Congress fails to fulfill its constitutional duty.  In a shameful bipartisan vote today, the US Senate failed to end US support for Saudi Arabia’s proxy war against Iran in Yemen that has caused devastating destruction, death, and suffering.

Too many members of Congress, from both parties, are listening to the banks and their lobbyists who write big checks to their campaigns, rather than listening to the voices of the American people who suffer as a result. This is corrupt and wrong.
People are demanding accountability, that Congress break up the big banks and hold them accountable for their risky behavior that devastated people’s lives and caused our economy to crash.

Millions of Americans have struggled since the 2008 Recession, but Wall Street hasn’t. The banks that were too big to fail then are even bigger today. The people who lost their homes, jobs and life savings were not bailed out like the banks were.

@Tim_Canova Thanks @Tim_Canova - there is much more to be done. This bill was crafted in a very narrow and specific way to urgently hack-proof our 2018 elections & deal with the vulnerabilities that exist in 35 states that don't have any form of voter-verified paper record of votes cast.

Instead of deregulating Wall Street banks that are bigger today than in 2008 when they were 'too big to fail', we should #reinstateGlassSteagal & strengthen oversight and regulations, and hold those responsible accountable for the crimes they committed against the American people

column5: We must reform America's broken criminal justice system by working to reduce mandatory minimums for certain non-violent offenders, recidivism rates, crime rates, and the social and economic cost of an over-criminalized society. We need to end federal marijuana prohibition.

In order to stop the opioid epidemic, we must address the root of the problem. The pharmaceutical industry must be prosecuted and held criminally accountable for their lies and the spread of these deadly prescription drugs. https://t.co/ZCk2Kp3sN4
We must ensure universal healthcare through #MedicareForAll and empower the government to negotiate with pharmaceutical companies to bring down the price of prescription drugs.

The Health Care Workplace Violence Prevention Act addresses a glaring need - in 2014, 52% of all workplace violence involved healthcare workers. Nurses and healthcare workers' personal safety must be guaranteed so that they can provide patients with the best care possible.
The federal government must do more to help Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands recover and rebuild from the devastation of Hurricane Maria. https://t.co/15Bs0mt8qL

We need to #RaiseTheWage to $15 an hour and give more than 41 million low-wage workers a raise. In Hawaiʻi and across the country, people working multiple jobs still can't afford the skyrocketing cost of living. That has to change.

Federal marijuana prohibition has ruined countless lives without making us safer. The so-called "War on Drugs" has failed. We must pass H.R. 1227, The Ending Federal Marijuana Prohibition Act, and find real solutions to the issues in our criminal justice and healthcare systems.

Big Pharma created the opioid crisis. They deceived doctors, patients, and the public about opioids' dangerous and addictive nature. They must be criminally prosecuted and held accountable for the deaths and lives that have been ruined as a result of their greed and lies.

It's time for the United States to guarantee #MedicareForAll. I'm proud to cosponsor H.R. 676, The Expanded & Improved Medicare For All Act, that would extend healthcare coverage to the millions of uninsured and underinsured people across our nation.

We must continue to speak up, today and each day, to guarantee equal pay for equal work, protect women's right to choose, and help build a society with the spirit of aloha where people are treated equally as human beings. #InternationalWomensDay

The people of Hawaiʻi need more affordable housing, not units that are flipped and sold for profit. We must address the systemic issues that contribute to our homeless crisis and make sure that people's jobs pay enough to afford the cost of living. https://t.co/05lSygUM4k

Mahalo nui loa and a warm a hui hou to #Hawaii surf legend Uncle George Downing. He lived a life of aloha, shared his love for our islands with visitors from around the world, & helped to make surfing the sport it is today. https://t.co/dMMWV0MmeD
Add your name to my petition calling for direct talks with North Korea: https://t.co/3ahI5l5rYa

We must act now - President Trump must engage in talks directly with Kim Jong Un, and begin the negotiations that can lead us down a peaceful path toward eliminating this nuclear threat from North Korea.
Military leaders have spelled out in detail how a war with North Korea would be catastrophic. Today’s news should give us hope that peace is possible.

This is an affirmation of the diplomatic progress we can make towards peace when we are willing to directly negotiate without preconditions, do not pursue counterproductive regime change policies, and instead focus on how we can achieve peace.
South Korea’s national security chief said, “North Korea has no reason to possess nuclear weapons when military threats are resolved, and when North Korea’s regime is guaranteed.”

Just this morning, direct talks between North & South Korea indicated that with U.S. participation, we can achieve the following:

-Nuclear disarmament on the Korean Peninsula
-Normalizing relations between the U.S. & North Korea
-Suspension of nuclear and ballistic missile tests

In recent months, and particularly following the false missile alert in Hawaiʻi earlier this year, the rest of the country has begun to understand the reality that the people of Hawaiʻi have known all too well for far too long.
For years, I’ve been speaking out about the ever-increasing nuclear threat coming from North Korea and calling for direct talks to find a peaceful resolution to denuclearize the Korean peninsula.

The breaking diplomatic news coming out of the Korean Peninsula today further affirms what I have been calling for: the United States must engage in diplomatic talks with North Korea now. (Thread) https://t.co/9YwFDRzxsC

"“Aloha” means hello and goodbye in Hawaiian, as well as kindness, compassion and grace. They’re qualities best exercised when riding waves of emotion during intense debates. And—just maybe—they’re best nurtured by riding waves in the ocean." https://t.co/1WqQdrtnDo
Congress must work together on a permanent, bipartisan solution to DACA that keeps Dreamers #HereToStay. We cannot delay a moment longer.
Add your name to be a citizen cosponsor of the Securing America’s Elections Act today: https://t.co/pJHT1Tt1ZR

14 states, including Hawaii, already use voter-verified paper ballots or paper ballot back-ups. But as DEFCON 2017 hackers have tested & proven, many current elections systems are easily hackable. We need to pass HR5147 now to protect the integrity of 2018 elections and beyond.

I introduced a bill with a simple solution: the Securing America’s Elections Act (HR5147) would mandate paper ballots/paper ballot backups for Federal elections across the country to ensure there is an audible voter-verified paper record, to protect the integrity of our elections

Serious vulnerabilities in our elections systems have been exposed. Even with stronger cybersecurity, the reality is these systems can be hacked. We must counter those vulnerabilities. Voter-verified paper ballot/paper back-ups are a commonsense way to hack-proof our elections.

6. Let’s continue to do everything we can to protect our precious water resources and stop the extraction of dangerous fossil fuels. Let’s invest in renewable energy. Support the #OFFAct. Water is Life! https://t.co/aTjmCStGde

5. We must listen to native communities, whose sovereignty was violated with #DAPL construction. Whether we fight for clean water at Standing Rock, in Flint, Red Hill in Hawaiʻi or anywhere else, everyone’s voice should matter.

4. The fact that #DAPL had 5 oil spills in its first 6 months of operation should surprise no one. There is no clean or completely safe way to extract+transport fossil fuels. The science is clear. We need to cease fossil fuel production immediately & move to 100% renewable energy

3. The EIS was abandoned not long after President Trump took office, but water protectors have continued to organize. The Native Nations March, March for Science, People’s Climate March, and countless local efforts show a new path forward for putting people before profits.

1. One year ago, the Army Corps of Engineers granted the easement for the Dakota Access Pipeline to run beneath Lake Oahe, threatening the clean water supply of the Standing Rock Sioux and millions of people along the Missouri River. #NoDAPL
Congress must do the right thing and come together with a bipartisan, permanent fix to guarantee #DREAMers a future in the United States.

The opportunity and freedom of DACA have allowed DREAMers, including more than 600 in Hawaiʻi, to go to college, find a job, support their family, serve their country, and live free from the constant fear of deportation. Congress must enact a permanent, bipartisan solution now.

The #OFFAct immediately ends federal permitting for new fossil fuel projects. That means no offshore drilling, no pipelines, no more polluting water and the environment. We must reach 100 percent renewable energy by 2035.
Effective negotiations to denuclearize North Korea require an end to our failed and counterproductive regime change war policy. The people of Hawaiʻi and this country want peace.

Our leaders must take the nuclear threat from North Korea seriously. This is not a game. The prospect of intentional or unintentional nuclear war, which we experienced many times in the Cold War, shows why we must end our regime change policies and work for peace.

The U.S. has a history of regime change, like overthrowing Gaddafi in Libya after promising we wouldn't if he gave up his nuclear weapons. That is the reason why Kim Jong-un develops them - as the only deterrent keeping us from toppling his regime like we have in other countries.

We must engage in direct talks with North Korea to achieve peace. Unrealistic preconditions have failed us for decades. We need to de-escalate the nuclear crisis with the ultimate goal of denuclearizing the Korean Peninsula.

Instead of cutting renewable energy projects like the White House proposed, we should invest in the technology of the future like Kauaʻi has to lower energy rates and stop burning fossil fuel. 100% renewable energy by 2035 is possible with the #OFFAct. https://t.co/cKmoolbpxK
The actions we take now not only impact the health and safety of current generations, but every generation to come. The necessity of keeping our water clean cannot be overstated.

All of these horrific shootings call for reflection, for
us to tackle issues with aloha & bipartisanship, even when we strongly disagree.

We need to learn how to disagree on issues
 - strongly - and not be disagreeable, not demonize each other.

Washington and our nation need aloha - a
 deep, abiding respect and love for one another - despite differences in politics, race & religion. https://t.co/Sa7AzmHKTq

Terrible news this morning. My prayers are with @SteveScalise, my colleagues, their staff, and @CapitolPolice who took immediate action

Even speaking of the genocide in Turkey is still a crime.   President Erdogan has
imprisoned journalists and activists for speaking of it.

Turkey still refuses to recognize the Armenian Genocide. 1.5 M people were
murdered as the Ottoman Empire transitioned to Turkish Republic.
Today marks Armenian Republic day when Armenian survivors of genocide established their own independent territory.

RT @AFLCIO: More than half of the 41 million workers who would benefit from #RaiseTheWage Act are between the ages of 25 and 54. https://t.…
Too many ppl working full-time minimum wage jobs are struggling just to get by. Today I joined @BernieSanders & intro'd #RaiseTheWage Act https://t.co/SKXW4Y890V
The images coming from Manchester tonight are heartbreaking. My prayers are with the victims and their families #Manchester
@maziehirono Welcome back Mazie! Good to see you're doing well and back at the Capitol.
In 2011 Trump says Saudi is "the world's biggest funder of terrorism." But yesterday #TrumpinSaudi signs massive arms deal. What happened? https://t.co/YMQWBMZtlP

Ironic- #TrumpinSaudi touring new 'center to combat extremist ideology' in Saudi, when Saudi spends billions $$ to spread extremist ideology
Opening counter-terrorism center in Saudi is a farce; Saudi is #1 exporter of Wahhabi Salafi jihadist ideology that fuels grps like ISIS/AQ
#TrumpinSaudi fails to acknowledge Saudi Arabia remains world's largest sponsor of terror & Wahhabi Salafist ideology fueling al-Qaeda/ISIS
Trump support of Saudi Arabia-a brutal theocracy & biggest sponsor of terrorism & the Wahhabi Salafi ideology fueling it-is a HUGE betrayal
Trump's arms deal enables Saudi to use US-made weapons in their war crimes against Yemeni civilians in a brutal civil war #StopArmingSaudi
POTUS $460B Saudi arms deal only prolongs & complicates our fight against terrorism - ensuring another decade of unjust wars in the MidEast
I believe in the power of people and our ability to take action toward a brighter future. Mahalo for allowing me the privilege to serve.
Citizens United worsened the crisis of dark money influencing our country.  We need to get corporate money and lobbyists out of politics.
When I was first elected to Congress, I promised that money wouldn't influence my decisions - I rejected $ from Wall St, Big Pharma, &others
I've decided to stop accepting PAC/lobbyist $$.  Bottom line: we can't allow our future to be driven and shaped by special interests.
The FCC is repealing #NetNeutrality against massive grassroots opposition. Sign our petition to fight this decision: https://t.co/dDaprQVjmw

Today's #climatemarch sends a clear message: protect Mother Earth by phasing out polluting fossil fuels and phasing in renewable energy.
